decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. It utilizes cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while also including various tutor effects to search for combo pieces. Additionally, it features disruptive elements like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect the combo, as well as cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Goblin Welder for additional control. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.

The deck revolves around controlling the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. It focuses on setting up combos with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells and manipulate the top of the library, while also using Terminus and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck also includes win conditions in Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game once control has been established. It emphasizes card selection and efficient resource management to navigate through a variety of matchups.

This Maverick deck focuses on aggressive plays with efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also uses powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to maximize combat effectiveness. With a strong mana base and disruptive cards like Deathrite Shaman and Gaddock Teeg, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early while maintaining control over the game with versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck's versatility and efficiency make it a strong contender in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while also putting pressure on them with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, True-Name Nemesis, and Tombstalker. It also utilizes powerful disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach, Abrupt Decay, and Force of Will to control the game. The inclusion of Deathrite Shaman allows for mana ramp and graveyard disruption. The land base is optimized for consistency and includes powerful cards like Wasteland and Underground Sea. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a midrange/aggro shell.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge ability to rapidly fill the graveyard with creature cards, allowing for explosive plays and synergies with cards like Bridge from Below. By cycling through the deck with cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study, the player can quickly bring back powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Ichorid from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy add additional layers of strategy and disruption to the combo-centric gameplay. Overall, this deck focuses on graveyard manipulation and recursion to overwhelm the opponent with an explosive combo.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and Stifle effects. It utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure while also controlling the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Stifle while maintaining a low land count to maximize the effectiveness of cards like Daze. It also includes Winter Orb to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells to control the game and outmaneuver opponents. It includes powerful control cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, Terminus, and Counterbalance to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing powerful card filtering effects like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top. The mana base is built to support the three-color combination of white, blue, and potentially red, allowing for flexibility in card choices while maintaining a solid mana base in Legacy format.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to control the game and pressure the opponent quickly. Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail provide additional disruption, while cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Lotus Petal offer versatility and additional power. The mana base is optimized for casting Eldrazi creatures efficiently, with cards like Ancient Tomb, Cavern of Souls, and Eye of Ugin ensuring a smooth curve. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and efficient threat deployment.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique. The Stoneforge Mystic package enhances the control aspect with equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, providing additional threats and utility. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage to maintain control and outvalue opponents. With a solid manabase and versatile answers, this Control Stoneblade deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through strong gameplay decisions and strategic choices.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by manipulating the top of the deck with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top while using counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell to disrupt opponents. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats and board wipes like Terminus to reset the board. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Monastery Mentor provide card advantage and threats to win the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on using direct damage spells and aggressive creatures to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The goal is to maintain pressure and prevent the opponent from stabilizing, while also utilizing cards like Price of Progress to punish them for playing non-basic lands. The combination of burn spells and efficient creatures allows this deck to close out games quickly and win before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while disrupting opponents with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland. The deck also includes versatile cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures, and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt opposing graveyard strategies. The deck aims to apply early pressure while controlling the board and disrupting opponents' strategies, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of powerful creatures and disruption spells.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful tempo cards like Gitaxian Probe and Force of Will to gain advantage. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan with access to a variety of colors for flexibility in casting spells. This deck aims to win the game quickly by applying constant pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to maintain control of the game through efficient counterspells and removal spells, while also leveraging card advantage and manipulation tools like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Sensei's Divining Top, and Brainstorm. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing the synergy between Counterbalance and Top. Monastery Mentor provides a win condition along with Snapcaster Mage, allowing the deck to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and direct burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total to zero as quickly as possible. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Sulfuric Vortex provide additional pressure and punishment for the opponent, making it difficult for them to stabilize or gain life.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various powerful spells and creatures, with a focus on manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Nahiri, the Harbinger for additional value. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Aeons Torn as a win condition adds an extra dimension to the control strategy.
